Description: Shoulder fragment of South Ionian (Milesian?) Middle Wild Goat II pottery dinos; interior reserved with wheelmarks; exterior: part of a deer to right; filling ornament: swastika with rounded angles; the spots on the deer are reserved. Clay light brown with grey core, sandy feel, some lime inclusions, much silver and some gold mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Published as an oinochoe in CVA Oxford 2, II D, p. 78, no. 6, pl. IV.
Bibliographic references: CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (II D, pl. IV, 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.030)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
